p.s: The Newspapernewspaper Articlearticle Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't Publishedpublished in The Telegraph on 27 January 2015 is written by John Worne.
He starts his article by bringing a problem up, that little to nobody learns a foreign language.
Some primary schools have languages in their program, but this does not help, as a study shows comparing A-levels from 2015 with 1990.

As counter argumentscounterarguments Worne states that you do not have to learn a foreign language, since most of the people abroad speak EnglischEnglish anyways or technology will help you, but he replysreplies that not everybody speaks EnglischEnglish and that using technology is often very unpractical.
The author then states, that language learning is exentialessential for the UK, since a study shows that two-thirds of UK business needs another language because many companies hire people abroad.
John Worne then shows what a solution might be: universitysuniversities offering students to learn a new language.
But not everybody does this, even though knowing another language is great for employers.
